item.title: Dynamic vs Normal Round Robin Scheduling Comparison
item.description: Github Repo 1. Introduction CPU scheduling is a crucial aspect of operating systems, allowing efficient utilization of CPU and I/O resources. This project implements and compares two variations of the Round Robin (RR) algorithm: Normal Round Robin and Dynamic Round Robin. The Round Robin algorithm is designed for time-sharing systems, allowing processes to use the CPU for a fixed time quantum before switching to the next process. 2. Project Structure The project consists of four main classes:
